channel.title: I want to setup SSL certificates provided by Godaddy on digital ocean's droplet
channel.description: I have redash server provided by digital ocean deployed via docker composer. I want to set up SSL certificates provide by GoDaddy. I am using https://gist.github.com/arikfr/64c9ff8d2f2b703d4e44fe9e45a7730e this document as a reference and I'm Skipping step 8 to generate letsencrypt SSL certificates because I want to use my own certificates. But I'm unable to set up, any help?

item.title: I want to setup SSL certificates provided by Godaddy on digital ocean's droplet
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
There’s nothing particular about Redash in this regard. You can follow GoDaddy’s instructions here to configure the SSL with nginx. Redash uses a stock nginx container definition. The only special instruction is step 6 in the link you provided, which maps a local directory on your VM to a volume that the nginx container can read.

Read full topic
item.source: I want to setup SSL certificates provided by Godaddy on digital ocean's droplet

item.title: I want to setup SSL certificates provided by Godaddy on digital ocean's droplet
item.dc:creator: zeeshanmustafa1
item.description:
I have redash server provided by digital ocean deployed via docker composer. I want to set up SSL certificates provide by GoDaddy. I am using Setting up HTTPS with LetsEncrypt for Redash Docker Deployment · GitHub this document as a reference and I’m Skipping step 8 to generate letsencrypt SSL certificates because I want to use my own certificates. But I’m unable to set up, any help?

Read full topic
item.source: I want to setup SSL certificates provided by Godaddy on digital ocean's droplet
